1#ifndef UVW_UDP_INCLUDE_H
2#define UVW_UDP_INCLUDE_H

5#include <type_traits>
6#include <utility>
7#include <cstddef>
8#include <memory>
9#include <string>
10#include <uv.h>
11#include "request.hpp"
12#include "handle.hpp"
13#include "util.h"

15
16namespace uvw {
17
18
19/**
20 * @brief SendEvent event.
21 *
22 * It will be emitted by UDPHandle according with its functionalities.
23 */
24struct SendEvent {};
25
26
27/**
28 * @brief UDPDataEvent event.
29 *
30 * It will be emitted by UDPHandle according with its functionalities.
31 */
32struct UDPDataEvent {
33 explicit UDPDataEvent(Addr sndr, std::unique_ptr<char[]> buf, std::size_t len, bool part) noexcept;
34
35 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data; /*!< A bunch of data read on the stream. */
36 std::size_t length; /*!< The amount of data read on the stream. */
37 Addr sender; /*!< A valid instance of Addr. */
38 bool partial; /*!< True if the message was truncated, false otherwise. */
39};
40
41
42namespace details {
43
44
45enum class UVUDPFlags: std::underlying_type_t<uv_udp_flags> {
46 IPV6ONLY = UV_UDP_IPV6ONLY,
47 UDP_PARTIAL = UV_UDP_PARTIAL,
48 REUSEADDR = UV_UDP_REUSEADDR,
49 UDP_MMSG_CHUNK = UV_UDP_MMSG_CHUNK,
50 UDP_RECVMMSG = UV_UDP_RECVMMSG
51};
52
53
54enum class UVMembership: std::underlying_type_t<uv_membership> {
55 LEAVE_GROUP = UV_LEAVE_GROUP,
56 JOIN_GROUP = UV_JOIN_GROUP
57};
58
59
60class SendReq final: public Request<SendReq, uv_udp_send_t> {
61public:
62 using Deleter = void(*)(char *);
63
64 SendReq(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> loop, std::unique_ptr<char[], Deleter> dt, unsigned int len);
65
66 void send(uv_udp_t *handle, const struct sockaddr* addr);
67
68private:
69 std::unique_ptr<char[], Deleter> data;
70 uv_buf_t buf;
71};
72
73
74}
75
76
77/**
78 * @brief The UDPHandle handle.
79 *
80 * UDP handles encapsulate UDP communication for both clients and servers.<br/>
81 * By default, _IPv4_ is used as a template parameter. The handle already
82 * supports _IPv6_ out-of-the-box by using `uvw::IPv6`.
83 *
84 * To create an `UDPHandle` through a `Loop`, arguments follow:
85 *
86 * * An optional integer value that indicates optional flags used to initialize
87 * the socket.
88 *
89 * See the official
90 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/udp.html#c.uv_udp_init_ex)
91 * for further details.
92 */
93class UDPHandle final: public Handle<UDPHandle, uv_udp_t> {
94 template<typename I>
95 static void recvCallback(uv_udp_t *handle, ssize_t nread, const uv_buf_t *buf, const sockaddr *addr, unsigned flags) {
96 const typename details::IpTraits<I>::Type *aptr = reinterpret_cast<const typename details::IpTraits<I>::Type *>(addr);
97
98 UDPHandle &udp = *(static_cast<UDPHandle*>(handle->data));
99 // data will be destroyed no matter of what the value of nread is
100 std::unique_ptr<char[]> data{buf->base};
101
102 if(nread > 0) {
103 // data available (can be truncated)
104 udp.publish(UDPDataEvent{details::address<I>(aptr), std::move(data), static_cast<std::size_t>(nread), !(0 == (flags & UV_UDP_PARTIAL))});
105 } else if(nread == 0 && addr == nullptr) {
106 // no more data to be read, doing nothing is fine
107 } else if(nread == 0 && addr != nullptr) {
108 // empty udp packet
109 udp.publish(UDPDataEvent{details::address<I>(aptr), std::move(data), static_cast<std::size_t>(nread), false});
110 } else {
111 // transmission error
112 udp.publish(ErrorEvent(nread));
113 }
114 }
115
116public:
117 using Membership = details::UVMembership;
118 using Bind = details::UVUDPFlags;
119 using IPv4 = uvw::IPv4;
120 using IPv6 = uvw::IPv6;
121
122 explicit UDPHandle(ConstructorAccess ca, std::shared_ptr<Loop> ref, unsigned int f = {});
123
124 /**
125 * @brief Initializes the handle. The actual socket is created lazily.
126 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
127 */
128 bool init();
129
130 /**
131 * @brief Opens an existing file descriptor or SOCKET as a UDP handle.
132 *
133 * The passed file descriptor or SOCKET is not checked for its type, but
134 * itâ€™s required that it represents a valid datagram socket.
135 *
136 * See the official
137 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/udp.html#c.uv_udp_open)
138 * for further details.
139 *
140 * @param socket A valid socket handle (either a file descriptor or a SOCKET).
141 */
142 void open(OSSocketHandle socket);
143
144 /**
145 * @brief Binds the UDP handle to an IP address and port.
146 *
147 * Available flags are:
148 *
149 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::IPV6ONLY`
150 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_PARTIAL`
151 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::REUSEADDR`
152 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_RECVMMSG`
153 *
154 * See the official
155 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/udp.html#c.uv_udp_flags)
156 * for further details.
157 *
158 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
159 * @param opts Optional additional flags.
160 */
161 void bind(const sockaddr &addr, Flags<Bind> opts = Flags<Bind>{});
162
163 /**
164 * @brief Associates the handle to a remote address and port (either IPv4 or
165 * IPv6).
166 *
167 * Every message sent by this handle is automatically sent to the given
168 * destination.<br/>
169 * Trying to call this function on an already connected handle isn't
170 * allowed.
171 *
172 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors during the connection.
173 *
174 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
175 */
176 void connect(const sockaddr &addr);
177
178 /**
179 * @brief Associates the handle to a remote address and port (either IPv4 or
180 * IPv6).
181 *
182 * Every message sent by this handle is automatically sent to the given
183 * destination.<br/>
184 * Trying to call this function on an already connected handle isn't
185 * allowed.
186 *
187 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors during the connection.
188 *
189 * @param ip The address to which to bind.
190 * @param port The port to which to bind.
191 */
192 template<typename I = IPv4>
193 void connect(std::string ip, unsigned int port);
194
195 /**
196 * @brief Associates the handle to a remote address and port (either IPv4 or
197 * IPv6).
198 *
199 * Every message sent by this handle is automatically sent to the given
200 * destination.<br/>
201 * Trying to call this function on an already connected handle isn't
202 * allowed.
203 *
204 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors during the connection.
205 *
206 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
207 */
208 template<typename I = IPv4>
209 void connect(Addr addr);
210
211 /**
212 * @brief Disconnects the handle.
213 *
214 * Trying to disconnect a handle that is not connected isn't allowed.
215 *
216 * An ErrorEvent event is emitted in case of errors.
217 */
218 void disconnect();
219
220 /**
221 * @brief Gets the remote address to which the handle is connected, if any.
222 * @return A valid instance of Addr, an empty one in case of errors.
223 */
224 template<typename I = IPv4>
225 Addr peer() const noexcept;
226
227 /**
228 * @brief Binds the UDP handle to an IP address and port.
229 *
230 * Available flags are:
231 *
232 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::IPV6ONLY`
233 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_PARTIAL`
234 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::REUSEADDR`
235 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_MMSG_CHUNK`
236 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_RECVMMSG`
237 *
238 * See the official
239 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/udp.html#c.uv_udp_flags)
240 * for further details.
241 *
242 * @param ip The IP address to which to bind.
243 * @param port The port to which to bind.
244 * @param opts Optional additional flags.
245 */
246 template<typename I = IPv4>
247 void bind(std::string ip, unsigned int port, Flags<Bind> opts = Flags<Bind>{});
248
249 /**
250 * @brief Binds the UDP handle to an IP address and port.
251 *
252 * Available flags are:
253 *
254 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::IPV6ONLY`
255 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_PARTIAL`
256 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::REUSEADDR`
257 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_MMSG_CHUNK`
258 * * `UDPHandle::Bind::UDP_RECVMMSG`
259 *
260 * See the official
261 * [documentation](http://docs.libuv.org/en/v1.x/udp.html#c.uv_udp_flags)
262 * for further details.
263 *
264 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
265 * @param opts Optional additional flags.
266 */
267 template<typename I = IPv4>
268 void bind(Addr addr, Flags<Bind> opts = Flags<Bind>{});
269
270 /**
271 * @brief Get the local IP and port of the UDP handle.
272 * @return A valid instance of Addr, an empty one in case of errors.
273 */
274 template<typename I = IPv4>
275 Addr sock() const noexcept;
276
277 /**
278 * @brief Sets membership for a multicast address.
279 *
280 * Available values for `membership` are:
281 *
282 * * `UDPHandle::Membership::LEAVE_GROUP`
283 * * `UDPHandle::Membership::JOIN_GROUP`
284 *
285 * @param multicast Multicast address to set membership for.
286 * @param iface Interface address.
287 * @param membership Action to be performed.
288 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
289 */
290 template<typename I = IPv4>
291 bool multicastMembership(std::string multicast, std::string iface, Membership membership);
292
293 /**
294 * @brief Sets IP multicast loop flag.
295 *
296 * This makes multicast packets loop back to local sockets.
297 *
298 * @param enable True to enable multicast loop, false otherwise.
299 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
300 */
301 bool multicastLoop(bool enable = true);
302
303 /**
304 * @brief Sets the multicast ttl.
305 * @param val A value in the range `[1, 255]`.
306 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
307 */
308 bool multicastTtl(int val);
309
310 /**
311 * @brief Sets the multicast interface to send or receive data on.
312 * @param iface Interface address.
313 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
314 */
315 template<typename I = IPv4>
316 bool multicastInterface(std::string iface);
317
318 /**
319 * @brief Sets broadcast on or off.
320 * @param enable True to set broadcast on, false otherwise.
321 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
322 */
323 bool broadcast(bool enable = false);
324
325 /**
326 * @brief Sets the time to live.
327 * @param val A value in the range `[1, 255]`.
328 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
329 */
330 bool ttl(int val);
331
332 /**
333 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
334 *
335 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
336 * will be bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a
337 * random port number.
338 *
339 * The handle takes the ownership of the data and it is in charge of delete
340 * them.
341 *
342 * A SendEvent event will be emitted when the data have been sent.<br/>
343 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
344 *
345 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
346 * @param data The data to be sent.
347 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
348 */
349 void send(const sockaddr &addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len);
350
351 /**
352 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
353 *
354 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
355 * will be bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a
356 * random port number.
357 *
358 * The handle takes the ownership of the data and it is in charge of delete
359 * them.
360 *
361 * A SendEvent event will be emitted when the data have been sent.<br/>
362 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
363 *
364 * @param ip The address to which to send data.
365 * @param port The port to which to send data.
366 * @param data The data to be sent.
367 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
368 */
369 template<typename I = IPv4>
370 void send(std::string ip, unsigned int port, std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len);
371
372 /**
373 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
374 *
375 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
376 * will be bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a
377 * random port number.
378 *
379 * The handle takes the ownership of the data and it is in charge of delete
380 * them.
381 *
382 * A SendEvent event will be emitted when the data have been sent.<br/>
383 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
384 *
385 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
386 * @param data The data to be sent.
387 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
388 */
389 template<typename I = IPv4>
390 void send(Addr addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len);
391
392 /**
393 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
394 *
395 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
396 * will be bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a
397 * random port number.
398 *
399 * The handle doesn't take the ownership of the data. Be sure that their
400 * lifetime overcome the one of the request.
401 *
402 * A SendEvent event will be emitted when the data have been sent.<br/>
403 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
404 *
405 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
406 * @param data The data to be sent.
407 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
408 */
409 void send(const sockaddr &addr, char *data, unsigned int len);
410
411 /**
412 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
413 *
414 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
415 * will be bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a
416 * random port number.
417 *
418 * The handle doesn't take the ownership of the data. Be sure that their
419 * lifetime overcome the one of the request.
420 *
421 * A SendEvent event will be emitted when the data have been sent.<br/>
422 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
423 *
424 * @param ip The address to which to send data.
425 * @param port The port to which to send data.
426 * @param data The data to be sent.
427 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
428 */
429 template<typename I = IPv4>
430 void send(std::string ip, unsigned int port, char *data, unsigned int len);
431
432 /**
433 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
434 *
435 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
436 * will be bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a
437 * random port number.
438 *
439 * The handle doesn't take the ownership of the data. Be sure that their
440 * lifetime overcome the one of the request.
441 *
442 * A SendEvent event will be emitted when the data have been sent.<br/>
443 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
444 *
445 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
446 * @param data The data to be sent.
447 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
448 */
449 template<typename I = IPv4>
450 void send(Addr addr, char *data, unsigned int len);
451
452 /**
453 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
454 *
455 * Same as `send()`, but it wonâ€™t queue a send request if it canâ€™t be
456 * completed immediately.
457 *
458 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
459 * @param data The data to be sent.
460 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
461 * @return Number of bytes written.
462 */
463 template<typename I = IPv4>
464 int trySend(const sockaddr &addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len);
465
466 /**
467 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
468 *
469 * Same as `send()`, but it wonâ€™t queue a send request if it canâ€™t be
470 * completed immediately.
471 *
472 * @param ip The address to which to send data.
473 * @param port The port to which to send data.
474 * @param data The data to be sent.
475 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
476 * @return Number of bytes written.
477 */
478 template<typename I = IPv4>
479 int trySend(std::string ip, unsigned int port, std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len);
480
481 /**
482 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
483 *
484 * Same as `send()`, but it wonâ€™t queue a send request if it canâ€™t be
485 * completed immediately.
486 *
487 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
488 * @param data The data to be sent.
489 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
490 * @return Number of bytes written.
491 */
492 template<typename I = IPv4>
493 int trySend(Addr addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]> data, unsigned int len);
494
495 /**
496 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
497 *
498 * Same as `send()`, but it wonâ€™t queue a send request if it canâ€™t be
499 * completed immediately.
500 *
501 * @param addr Initialized `sockaddr_in` or `sockaddr_in6` data structure.
502 * @param data The data to be sent.
503 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
504 * @return Number of bytes written.
505 */
506 template<typename I = IPv4>
507 int trySend(const sockaddr &addr, char *data, unsigned int len);
508
509 /**
510 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
511 *
512 * Same as `send()`, but it wonâ€™t queue a send request if it canâ€™t be
513 * completed immediately.
514 *
515 * @param ip The address to which to send data.
516 * @param port The port to which to send data.
517 * @param data The data to be sent.
518 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
519 * @return Number of bytes written.
520 */
521 template<typename I = IPv4>
522 int trySend(std::string ip, unsigned int port, char *data, unsigned int len);
523
524 /**
525 * @brief Sends data over the UDP socket.
526 *
527 * Same as `send()`, but it wonâ€™t queue a send request if it canâ€™t be
528 * completed immediately.
529 *
530 * @param addr A valid instance of Addr.
531 * @param data The data to be sent.
532 * @param len The lenght of the submitted data.
533 * @return Number of bytes written.
534 */
535 template<typename I = IPv4>
536 int trySend(Addr addr, char *data, unsigned int len);
537
538 /**
539 * @brief Prepares for receiving data.
540 *
541 * Note that if the socket has not previously been bound with `bind()`, it
542 * is bound to `0.0.0.0` (the _all interfaces_ IPv4 address) and a random
543 * port number.
544 *
545 * An UDPDataEvent event will be emitted when the handle receives data.<br/>
546 * An ErrorEvent event will be emitted in case of errors.
547 */
548 template<typename I = IPv4>
549 void recv();
550
551 /**
552 * @brief Stops listening for incoming datagrams.
553 */
554 void stop();
555
556 /**
557 * @brief Gets the number of bytes queued for sending.
558 *
559 * It strictly shows how much information is currently queued.
560 *
561 * @return Number of bytes queued for sending.
562 */
563 size_t sendQueueSize() const noexcept;
564
565 /**
566 * @brief Number of send requests currently in the queue awaiting to be processed.
567 * @return Number of send requests currently in the queue.
568 */
569 size_t sendQueueCount() const noexcept;
570
571private:
572 enum { DEFAULT, FLAGS } tag{DEFAULT};
573 unsigned int flags{};
574};
575
576

578 * @cond TURN_OFF_DOXYGEN
579 * Internal details not to be documented.
580 */

583// (extern) explicit instantiations
584
585extern template void UDPHandle::connect<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int);
586extern template void UDPHandle::connect<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int);
587
588extern template void UDPHandle::connect<IPv4>(Addr);
589extern template void UDPHandle::connect<IPv6>(Addr);
590
591extern template Addr UDPHandle::peer<IPv4>() const noexcept;
592extern template Addr UDPHandle::peer<IPv6>() const noexcept;
593
594extern template void UDPHandle::bind<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int, Flags<Bind>);
595extern template void UDPHandle::bind<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int, Flags<Bind>);
596
597extern template void UDPHandle::bind<IPv4>(Addr, Flags<Bind>);
598extern template void UDPHandle::bind<IPv6>(Addr, Flags<Bind>);
599
600extern template Addr UDPHandle::sock<IPv4>() const noexcept;
601extern template Addr UDPHandle::sock<IPv6>() const noexcept;
602
603extern template bool UDPHandle::multicastMembership<IPv4>(std::string, std::string, Membership);
604extern template bool UDPHandle::multicastMembership<IPv6>(std::string, std::string, Membership);
605
606extern template bool UDPHandle::multicastInterface<IPv4>(std::string);
607extern template bool UDPHandle::multicastInterface<IPv6>(std::string);
608
609extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
610extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
611
612extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv4>(Addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
613extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv6>(Addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
614
615extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int, char *, unsigned int);
616extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int, char *, unsigned int);
617
618extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv4>(Addr, char *, unsigned int);
619extern template void UDPHandle::send<IPv6>(Addr, char *, unsigned int);
620
621extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv4>(const sockaddr &, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
622extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv6>(const sockaddr &, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
623
624extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
625extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
626
627extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv4>(Addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
628extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv6>(Addr, std::unique_ptr<char[]>, unsigned int);
629
630extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv4>(const sockaddr &, char *, unsigned int);
631extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv6>(const sockaddr &, char *, unsigned int);
632
633extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv4>(std::string, unsigned int, char *, unsigned int);
634extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv6>(std::string, unsigned int, char *, unsigned int);
635
636extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv4>(Addr, char *, unsigned int);
637extern template int UDPHandle::trySend<IPv6>(Addr, char *, unsigned int);
638
639extern template void UDPHandle::recv<IPv4>();
640extern template void UDPHandle::recv<IPv6>();
641
